info.title: FortiOS CMDB
info.description: REST API for configuring FortiOS objects and settings

tags.name: icap/server-group
tags.description: Configure an ICAP server group consisting of multiple forward servers. Supports failover and load balancing.

get.summary:
Select a specific entry from a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

request.description:
Enable/disable whether an HTTP request is passed to an ICAP server.   
disable:Disable HTTP request passing to ICAP server.   
enable:Enable HTTP request passing to ICAP server.

response.description:
Enable/disable whether an HTTP response is passed to an ICAP server.   
disable:Disable HTTP response passing to ICAP server.   
enable:Enable HTTP response passing to ICAP server.

file-transfer.description:
Configure the file transfer protocols to pass transferred files to an ICAP server as REQMOD.   
ssh:Forward file transfer with SSH protocol to ICAP server for further processing.   
ftp:Forward file transfer with FTP protocol to ICAP server for further processing.

streaming-content-bypass.description:
Enable/disable bypassing of ICAP server for streaming content.   
disable:Disable bypassing of ICAP server for streaming content.   
enable:Enable bypassing of ICAP server for streaming content.

ocr-only.description:
Enable/disable this FortiGate unit to submit only OCR interested content to the ICAP server.   
disable:Disable this FortiGate unit to submit only OCR interested content to the ICAP server.   
enable:Enable this FortiGate unit to submit only OCR interested content to the ICAP server.

204-size-limit.description: 204 response size limit to be saved by ICAP client in megabytes (1 - 10, default = 1 MB).

204-response.description:
Enable/disable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.   
disable:Disable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.   
enable:Enable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.

preview.description:
Enable/disable preview of data to ICAP server.   
disable:Disable preview of data to ICAP server.   
enable:Enable preview of data to ICAP server.

preview-data-length.description: Preview data length to be sent to ICAP server.

request-server.description: ICAP server to use for an HTTP request.

response-server.description: ICAP server to use for an HTTP response.

file-transfer-server.description: ICAP server to use for a file transfer.

request-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing an HTTP request.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

response-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing an HTTP response.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

file-transfer-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing a file transfer.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

request-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the HTTP request processing service.

response-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the HTTP response processing service.

file-transfer-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the file transfer processing service.

methods.description:
The allowed HTTP methods that will be sent to ICAP server for further processing.   
delete:Forward HTTP request or response with DELETE method to ICAP server for further processing.   
get:Forward HTTP request or response with GET method to ICAP server for further processing.   
head:Forward HTTP request or response with HEAD method to ICAP server for further processing.   
options:Forward HTTP request or response with OPTIONS method to ICAP server for further processing.   
post:Forward HTTP request or response with POST method to ICAP server for further processing.   
put:Forward HTTP request or response with PUT method to ICAP server for further processing.   
trace:Forward HTTP request or response with TRACE method to ICAP server for further processing.   
connect:Forward HTTP request or response with CONNECT method to ICAP server for further processing.   
other:Forward HTTP request or response with All other methods to ICAP server for further processing.

response-req-hdr.description:
Enable/disable addition of req-hdr for ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.   
disable:Do not add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.   
enable:Add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.

respmod-default-action.description:
Default action to ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.   
forward:Forward response to ICAP server unless a rule specifies not to.   
bypass:Don't forward request to ICAP server unless a rule specifies to forward the request.

icap-block-log.description:
Enable/disable UTM log when infection found (default = disable).   
disable:Disable UTM log when infection found.   
enable:Enable UTM log when infection found.

chunk-encap.description:
Enable/disable chunked encapsulation (default = disable).   
disable:Do not encapsulate chunked data.   
enable:Encapsulate chunked data into a new chunk.

extension-feature.description:
Enable/disable ICAP extension features.   
scan-progress:Support X-Scan-Progress-Interval ICAP header.

timeout.description: Time (in seconds) that ICAP client waits for the response from ICAP server.

base64-encoding.description:
Enable/disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.   
disable:Disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.   
enable:Enable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.

case-sensitivity.description:
Enable/disable case sensitivity when matching header.   
disable:Ignore case when matching header.   
enable:Do not ignore case when matching header.

action.description:
Action to be taken for ICAP server.   
forward:Forward request to ICAP server when this rule is matched.   
bypass:Don't forward request to ICAP server when this rule is matched.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

401.description: Not Authorized: Request without successful login session

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Attribute name that references other table

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.name: skip_to_datasource
parameters.description: Skip to provided table's Nth entry. E.g {datasource: 'firewall.address', pos: 10, global_entry: false}

parameters.name: acs
parameters.description: If true, returned result are in ascending order.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If present, the objects will be filtered by the search value.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
datasource: Return all applicable datasource entries for a specific attribute based on simulate data.
stats: Return CMDB aggregated statistics.
find-index: Return indexes of provided primary keys with respect to filter.
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
json-schema: Return the JSON Schema for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).
transaction-show: Show the content of the configuration transaction by transcation ID.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

put.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

0.name: datasource
0.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

2.name: count
2.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

4.name: with_meta
4.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

5.name: with_contents_hash
5.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

6.name: skip
6.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

7.name: format
7.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

9.name: key
9.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

10.name: pattern
10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

13.name: datasource_format
13.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

14.name: skip_to
14.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

15.name: unfiltered_count
15.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

16.name: filter
16.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

17.name: key
17.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

18.name: pattern
18.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

20.name: stat-items
20.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

21.name: filter
21.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

22.name: primary_keys
22.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

25.name: action
25.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

disable:Disable this FortiGate unit to submit only OCR interested content to the ICAP server.   
enable:Enable this FortiGate unit to submit only OCR interested content to the ICAP server.

204-size-limit.description: 204 response size limit to be saved by ICAP client in megabytes (1 - 10, default = 1 MB).

204-response.description:
Enable/disable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.   
disable:Disable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.   
enable:Enable allowance of 204 response from ICAP server.

preview.description:
Enable/disable preview of data to ICAP server.   
disable:Disable preview of data to ICAP server.   
enable:Enable preview of data to ICAP server.

preview-data-length.description: Preview data length to be sent to ICAP server.

request-server.description: ICAP server to use for an HTTP request.

response-server.description: ICAP server to use for an HTTP response.

file-transfer-server.description: ICAP server to use for a file transfer.

request-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing an HTTP request.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

response-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing an HTTP response.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

file-transfer-failure.description:
Action to take if the ICAP server cannot be contacted when processing a file transfer.   
error:Error.   
bypass:Bypass.

request-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the HTTP request processing service.

response-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the HTTP response processing service.

file-transfer-path.description: Path component of the ICAP URI that identifies the file transfer processing service.

methods.description:
The allowed HTTP methods that will be sent to ICAP server for further processing.   
delete:Forward HTTP request or response with DELETE method to ICAP server for further processing.   
get:Forward HTTP request or response with GET method to ICAP server for further processing.   
head:Forward HTTP request or response with HEAD method to ICAP server for further processing.   
options:Forward HTTP request or response with OPTIONS method to ICAP server for further processing.   
post:Forward HTTP request or response with POST method to ICAP server for further processing.   
put:Forward HTTP request or response with PUT method to ICAP server for further processing.   
trace:Forward HTTP request or response with TRACE method to ICAP server for further processing.   
connect:Forward HTTP request or response with CONNECT method to ICAP server for further processing.   
other:Forward HTTP request or response with All other methods to ICAP server for further processing.

response-req-hdr.description:
Enable/disable addition of req-hdr for ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.   
disable:Do not add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.   
enable:Add req-hdr for response modification (respmod) processing.

respmod-default-action.description:
Default action to ICAP response modification (respmod) processing.   
forward:Forward response to ICAP server unless a rule specifies not to.   
bypass:Don't forward request to ICAP server unless a rule specifies to forward the request.

icap-block-log.description:
Enable/disable UTM log when infection found (default = disable).   
disable:Disable UTM log when infection found.   
enable:Enable UTM log when infection found.

chunk-encap.description:
Enable/disable chunked encapsulation (default = disable).   
disable:Do not encapsulate chunked data.   
enable:Encapsulate chunked data into a new chunk.

extension-feature.description:
Enable/disable ICAP extension features.   
scan-progress:Support X-Scan-Progress-Interval ICAP header.

timeout.description: Time (in seconds) that ICAP client waits for the response from ICAP server.

base64-encoding.description:
Enable/disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.   
disable:Disable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.   
enable:Enable use of base64 encoding of HTTP content.

case-sensitivity.description:
Enable/disable case sensitivity when matching header.   
disable:Ignore case when matching header.   
enable:Do not ignore case when matching header.

action.description:
Action to be taken for ICAP server.   
forward:Forward request to ICAP server when this rule is matched.   
bypass:Don't forward request to ICAP server when this rule is matched.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

get.summary:
Select a specific entry from a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

addr-type.description:
Address type of the remote ICAP server: IPv4, IPv6 or FQDN.   
ip4:Use an IPv4 address for the remote ICAP server.   
ip6:Use an IPv6 address for the remote ICAP server.   
fqdn:Use the FQDN for the forwarding proxy server.

ip-address.description: IPv4 address of the ICAP server.

ip6-address.description: IPv6 address of the ICAP server.

fqdn.description: ICAP remote server Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN).

max-connections.description: Maximum number of concurrent connections to ICAP server (unlimited = 0, default = 100). Must not be less than wad-worker-count.

secure.description:
Enable/disable secure connection to ICAP server.   
disable:Disable connection to secure ICAP server.   
enable:Enable connection to secure ICAP server.

healthcheck.description:
Enable/disable ICAP remote server health checking. Attempts to connect to the remote ICAP server to verify that the server is operating normally.   
disable:Disable health checking.   
enable:Enable health checking.

healthcheck-service.description: ICAP Service name to use for health checks.

_move_: Move this specific resource.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

5.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

7.name: format
7.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

9.name: key
9.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

10.name: pattern
10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

13.name: datasource_format
13.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

14.name: skip_to
14.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

15.name: unfiltered_count
15.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

16.name: filter
16.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

17.name: key
17.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

18.name: pattern
18.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

20.name: stat-items
20.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

21.name: filter
21.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

name.description: Configure an ICAP server group consisting one or multiple forward servers. Supports failover and load balancing.

ldb-method.description:
Load balance method.   
weighted:Load balance traffic to forward servers based on assigned weights.   
least-session:Send new sessions to the server with lowest session count.   
active-passive:Send new sessions to active server with high weight.

server-list.description: Add ICAP servers to a list to form a server group. Optionally assign weights to each server.

weight.description: Optionally assign a weight of the forwarding server for weighted load balancing (1 - 100, default = 10).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

get.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

name.description: Configure an ICAP server group consisting one or multiple forward servers. Supports failover and load balancing.

ldb-method.description:
Load balance method.   
weighted:Load balance traffic to forward servers based on assigned weights.   
least-session:Send new sessions to the server with lowest session count.   
active-passive:Send new sessions to active server with high weight.

server-list.description: Add ICAP servers to a list to form a server group. Optionally assign weights to each server.

weight.description: Optionally assign a weight of the forwarding server for weighted load balancing (1 - 100, default = 10).

0.name: datasource
0.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

2.name: count
2.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

4.name: with_meta
4.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

5.name: with_contents_hash
5.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

6.name: skip
6.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

7.name: format
7.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

9.name: key
9.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

10.name: pattern
10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

13.name: datasource_format
13.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

14.name: skip_to
14.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

15.name: unfiltered_count
15.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

16.name: filter
16.description:

!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).

<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

22.name: primary_keys

25.name: action
25.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom
